rev.desc.rev.desc: if (5 in $L.i in field in $L.format~=-1) then ($L.old=max(5 in $L.i in field in $L.format, $L.old)
if (5 in $L.i in field in $L.format>=0) then ($L.old=max(5 in $L.i in field in $L.format, $L.old)
Changed modify.format to only process the field if the window property does NOT equal -1.

Changed panel modify.format to do "type(evaluate(parse($L.temp ,8)))=8 then $L.temp=evaluate(parse($L.temp ,8)); " where it checks for an input field that starts with "$" then continued the rest of the line of code.
Fixed an issue with virtual joins. Was only printing one line. Now will print whatever the original window setting is, but will not expand.
Change the for loop to a while loop so expansion would not keep fields at bottom from being expanded also...
Fixed the "shrink" code so lines wont overwrite each other.
Fixed processing for $ variables contained in a format.

descript.descript: if (5 in $L.i in field in $L.format~=-1) then ($L.old=max(5 in $L.i in field in $L.format, $L.old)
if (5 in $L.i in field in $L.format>=0) then ($L.old=max(5 in $L.i in field in $L.format, $L.old)
Changed modify.format to only process the field if the window property does NOT equal -1.

Changed panel modify.format to do "type(evaluate(parse($L.temp ,8)))=8 then $L.temp=evaluate(parse($L.temp ,8)); " where it checks for an input field that starts with "$" then continued the rest of the line of code.
Fixed an issue with virtual joins. Was only printing one line. Now will print whatever the original window setting is, but will not expand.
Change the for loop to a while loop so expansion would not keep fields at bottom from being expanded also...
Fixed the "shrink" code so lines wont overwrite each other.
Fixed processing for $ variables contained in a format.
